comments:
I20050217-2000, self-hosted, KDE 3.3.2, GTK+ 2.4.14, X.Org 6.8.0, Linux 2.6.10

Once, when shutting down a self-hosted session, I got the following exception in
my log:

!SESSION 2005-02-18 13:27:30.241 -----------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=unknown
java.fullversion=J2RE 1.4.2 IBM J9 2.2 Linux x86-32 j9xia32142-20040826 (JIT
enabled)
J9VM - 20040825_0123_lHdSMR

(IBM J9 1.4.2 VM)/dev.properties -pdelaunch -os linux -ws gtk -arch x86

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 2005-02-18 13:29:39.199

	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:887)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:871)

I don't know how this could have happened.
ErrorDialog does exist in JFace, in that package.
JFace needs to be there for the workbench to exist.
Sometimes these are caused if the runtime is shutting down, but the workbench is
still up and running and hasn't even returned control to the application yet.

Pascal, any ideas?

Usually that happens when the plugin from which we are trying to load classes
has been shutdown. However the worrying part of this bug is that the stack trace
show that the plugin has not been shutdown yet.

Can you reproduce it consistently ?

Note that there are at least 6 plug-ins involved here: Osgi, Runtime, Swt,
JFace, Workbench, IDE.

ErrorDialog is in JFace.
Workbench and IDE have not been shutdown, and I guess that means JFace has not
been shutdown either.
No, I've only seen this problem once.

Doug, is there any chance you had attempted to delete the install before
shutting down?

An interesting question.  I suppose there is a chance, though it seems unlikely
to me.

I'm going to stick my head in the sand and mark as WORKSFORME.
Please reopen if you see it again.
